resources.string: Tap When You Hear A Beep

Calibration of your earphones must be performed in a quiet place by at least one normally hearing person between the ages of 18 and 35. Once the test begins, you will hear beeps of various pitches and volumes. Every time you hear a beep, simply tap the screen.
Simple Calibration: Requires good hearing at 1000 Hz and headphones are linear across the frequency range.
Full Calibration: Extensive tests between 125 Hz and 8000 Hz.
Do you want to keep your results?
If you can\'t find the test results in your inbox, be sure to check your junk or spam folder.
Export seems to have run into a problem. Please check your internet connection and try again. You can access your results at any time through the Test Results page and email from there!
Sorry! It seems there are no tests currently stored in memory. Please take a test, then return to this page to view the results.

This app can evaluate your hearing capabilities.
First your earphones must be calibrated. You can either perform a full test which requires one or better several persons between the ages of 18 and 35 with normal hearing. Or you can perform a simple calibration at 1000Hz only (assuming good hearing at this frequency). In this case it is assumed that the earphones are linear across the frequency range and calibration values for the other frequencies are then calculated using the ISO226:2003 standard.

Whenever you hear a beep simply touch the screen.

If you have several persons available for calibration simply press "Add Calibration" and an average value of existing calibrations will be calculated. You may also delete the whole calibration.

After that you can perform tests and view them in test results.

You can then also perform tests at single frequencies. There you can manually select ear, frequency, and sound amplitude by clicking on the buttons.
Do you like this app? Please star it on GitHub!
